applicationFees.general: INR 1000 (for a single course), INR 1500 (for combination of courses)
applicationFees.obc: INR 1000 (for a single course), INR 1500 (for combination of courses)
applicationFees.sc_st: INR 1000 (for a single course), INR 1500 (for combination of courses)

eligibility: Eligibility varies by course: For undergraduate courses (e.g., B.Pharm), candidates must have passed 10+2 with relevant subjects. For postgraduate courses (e.g., MBA, MCA), a relevant bachelor's degree is required. Detailed eligibility is specified in the official brochure.
maxMarks: Varies by course (e.g., 120 marks for most papers, 60 questions for MBA/MCA, 180 for B.Pharm, etc.)
negativeMarking: Yes, 1 mark deducted for each incorrect answer

faqs.question: Is OJEE required for B.Tech admission in Odisha?
faqs.answer: No, from 2015 onwards, admission to B.Tech and B.Arch in Odisha is based on JEE Main scores. OJEE is conducted for other courses such as B.Pharm, MBA, MCA, M.Tech, etc.[1]
